name: methadone
text: raw

name: saint
text: Ray's form is flawless.

name: spinynorman
text: somewhere Nolan Ryan both winces and applauds

name: carlyle
text: How can I top this comment? I can't. This is all to be said.

name: bookofsand
text: Beef is afraid that Ray is going to get drunk in the face of adversity. His fear is totally founded.

name: deimosrising
text: There is no other option but for the middle vehicle to pull a wheelie. Ought else is basest heresy.

name: woodenteeth
text:
chucking a SUPRISED wheelie!

ie: VROOOOOOOO!

name: senseihollywood
text: RAY=BADASS

name: senseihollywood
text: this is what the A-Team Movie would kinda be like

name: keithcozz
text: I DO love it when a plan comes together.

name: rasalghul
text: We'll find out this summer, I guess.

name: hellofyellin
text: Notice Ray has tied his Molotov in the less-popular "ETA Basque-knot" in consideration of the composition and availability of flammables.  Ray riots with his brain.

name: fourninefoxtrot
text: To notice the knot used to tie a rag on a Molotov is raw . Way to dig the science of the Fight.

name: aaron_haynes
text: Last panel absolutely makes it.

name: tinhand
text: A comment left by tinhand was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, Belgand, helikaon, mattylite, STUART, dr_sexlove)

name: andrew_
text: I'm listening to Such Great Heights by the Postal Service right now and I just don't know what to think.

name: ttagxamm
text: Reading through I've been listening to a mess of mostly obscure, mostly old thrash tracks, and they are at least as good as an eleven dollar bottle of brandy.

name: philophobe
text:
I'm thinking Dark Angel's 'Darkness Descends' sure would go right nice to these last few action strips of the story arc.

THE CITY IS GUILTY
THE CRIME IS LIFE
THE SENTENCE IS DEATH
DARKNESS DESCENDS

name: lastlarf
text: Blues at sunrise. Albert King and Stevie Ray Vaughan.

name: soticoto
text: Dragula by Rob Zombie.

name: gmm
text: Stockholm Syndrome by Muse for me. Not my usual thing but it fits the Great Outdoor Fight.

name: trollcollins
text: Oh my goodness it certainly does.

name: anzio
text: An orchestral score of some kind would fit better, I think.

name: swatson
text: Those Jeeps are saying to Beef and Ray, "come down now".  But they will stay.

name: i_love_kate
text:
Chubby for Give Up.

I've got R.E.M.'s Leave, and it feels pretty good.

name: rockstarsatemy
text: fuck you, i won't do what you told me.

name: dovey
text: Rated 5 for the simple fact of Jeep doing a wheelie

name: hellofyellin
text: Is that a skull or a pelvis strapped to the front of that middle jeep?

name: tekende
text: I'm not really sure how you could even make a Jeep do a wheelie.

name: fineoakstructure
text: You must not be a breast man, then.

name: daidai
text: No need to point out the weaknesses of a weak man now, fineoakstructure. No need at all.

name: deancain29
text: This is intense. and the premise for an Achewood movie?

name: i_love_kate
text:
The premise for a film as it exists in deancain's mind:

"A jeep does a wheelie and gets a molotov cocktail thrown at it."

name: cpnglxynchos
text: "...Philippe is NOT standing on it."

name: phthoggos
text: This is pretty much the best thing ever produced by humanity.

name: serf
text: alt txt won this one

name: peterjoel
text: serf, you are quite incorrect in that assessment.

name: rhino
text: Reminds me of that scene from The Warriors.

name: tourach3
text:
WARRRRRRRIORS
COME OUT AND PLAY-AY!

name: octafish
text: You seeee what you get Warriors? You seeee what you get when you mess with the Orphans? We're gunna rain on you, Warriors!

name: onepapertiger
text: A comment left by onepapertiger was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by dismas, kenthegod, atypicaloracle, Lumus, Satyr)

name: deusoma
text: Regardless of anyone's opinion of the movie, I think we can all agree it was silly to make a tie-in videogame 26 years later.

name: tekende
text: Yeah, I appreciate what it was doing and all, I appreciate the concept, but the movie itself is just not really that entertaining or anything.

name: onepapertiger
text:
I watched it on ODB's mention.
I listened to a wet-head.

name: tekende
text: ODB? Wet-head? I'm not sure what to think of this comment.

name: afronaut
text: MotherFUCKer

name: niraj
text: A throw for the ages

name: miku224
text: This was the first achewood strip I ever read, and even without a scrap of context, I loved it.  I think that fact has a lot to do with my current obsession.

name: miku224
text: And now I'm wandering through the archives, found this strip, and thought "hey! This was my first strip! I should make that obligatory comment." Apparently my memory for strips is far better than my memory for comments (especially ones I've made).

name: cherubrocker22
text: This strip is Ray standing up for his friend, in a way.

name: red-barchetta
text: I always wanted to take out a jeep that way! Go Ray!

name: dismas
text: Man, Onstad got a lot of mileage out of "pouf!" and variations thereof in the Fight arc.

name: quazifuji
text:
It just occurred to me how incredibly epic panel 8 is.

It would make an awesome wallpaper.

name: fermatprime
text: It's probably unintentional on Onstad's part, but note how both Ramses and Ray use alcoholic beverages and their containers to their advantage during the Fight.

name: cpnglxynchos
text: [IMGS OFF]

name: shadowlink97
text: I love beef's omega tetris look in the last panel lol

name: agentstinky
text: Last panel is one of my all-time favorite panels.

name: alilsneaky
text: Wow, Onstad put my exact thoughts on the 7th panel in the alt text.
